deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing.
insecure.
missing.
illegible.
not in accordance with the requirements.
missing.
of an incorrect type.

with excessive corrosion, serious deterioration or a fracture in a load bearing member of the vehicle structure within 30cm of the anchorage (where a seat belt is attached to a seat frame this will apply to all seat mounting points).

with excessive corrosion, serious deterioration or a fracture in a load bearing member of the vehicle structure within 30cm of the anchorage (where a seat belt is attached to a seat frame this will apply to all seat mounting points) and is likely to detach.
a seat belt not securely fixed to the seat or to the vehicle structure.

items.itemDescription: Locking Mechanism, Stalks, Retracting Mechanism and Fittings:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: locking mechanism of a seat belt does not secure or release as intended.
an attachment or adjustment fitting fractured, badly deteriorated or not operating effectively.
corrosion or deterioration of a flexible stalk likely to lead to failure under load.
broken flexible stalk strands
a retracting mechanism that does not retract the webbing sufficiently to remove all of the slack from the belt with the locking mechanism fastened and the seat unoccupied.
a cut or damage or fluffing or fraying, which is not sufficient to obstruct correct operation of the belt or which has not clearly weakened the webbing.
a cut or damage or fluffing or fraying or overstretching sufficient to obstruct correct operation of the belt or significantly weaken the webbing.
stitching badly frayed, insecure, incomplete or repaired.
so dirty that it is likely to soil passengers’ clothing.

items.itemDescription: Obvious signs of structural weakness in a Seat belt; fitting, guide,stalk or pivot

deficiencies.deficiencyText: such that failure is likely.

items.itemDescription: Seats with seat belts attached to them:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
with a cracked or fractured leg or frame.
load limiter or pretensioner obviously missing where fitted as original equipment.
pretensioner or a ‘folded type’ webbing load limiter obviously deployed.
missing.
deployed or disconnected.
indicates any kind of failure of the system.

items.itemDescription: Installation defect found during annual test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: any obvious installation defect found during the inspection.
evidence that original webbing has been cut and/or reworked (e.g. belts knotted, fraying or fluffing removed/sealed by burning etc.).
any part of the installation which has a sharp edge which could or is likely to cut or abrade the webbing.
a directly attached anchorage not secured by standard seat belt mounting bolts and washers as detailed in paragraph D.
an anchorage insecure.
a tubular seat frame that has been drilled for the purpose of attaching a seat belt.
a directly attached anchorage not attached to a load bearing member or without suitable reinforcement.
retro-fitted three point belt which is not mounted on a suitable structure.
tubular frame legs or tubular “H” pattern legs which have not been reinforced with buttressing and diagonal bracing, or buttressing where a floor mounted belt is fitted close to a seat leg.
belt fitted to a seat which has not been suitably reinforced or modified.
without suitable padding as detailed in paragraph L.
lower anchorages less than 320 mm apart.
in such a position that loading the belt causes the cushion to be raised or significantly compressed thus allowing the occupant to effectively move forward.
an anchorage attached to the floor without reinforcement plates of a suitable size and contour.
with load spreading washer(s) missing from anchorage bolt.
claw type seat mounting with inadequate means of securing claw.
on a seat fitted to a flat rail the bolt does not pass through the leg, rail, floor and a suitable structural member or the floor has not been suitably reinforced.
tracking for securing seats and wheelchairs insecure.
free movement for a looped belt more than 25mm at the anchorage.
upper anchorage of three point belt less than 475 mm above uncompressed seat cushion measured parallel to the seat back.
upper anchorage of three point belt(s) less than 110 mm from centre line of seat.
incorrect positioning of a lap belt or lap section of a three point belt. i.e. the belt lies across the stomach or forward of the top quarter of the thigh.
a seat belt component fitted to a seat significantly intrudes into a gangway and is likely to cause injury to a passenger.
for vehicles subject to enhanced seat belt requirements no evidence that seat belt anchorages are likely to meet the strength requirements of EC directive 76/115/EC as amended by directive 96/38/EC.

items.itemDescription: Compression Ignition Engines Statutory Visual Test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: After a maximum of six accelerations the exhaust emits smoke of a level greater than that of equivalent metered levels.
The exhaust emits excessive smoke or vapour, of any colour, to an extent likely to obscure vision.
After a maximum of six accelerations, the exhaust emits smoke of a level greater than that of equivalent metered levels.

items.itemDescription: Emission control equipment fitted by the manufacturer

deficiencies.deficiencyText: absent, or obviously defective or shows any signs of obvious tampering.

items.itemDescription: A vehicle equipped with a Diesel Particulate Filter

deficiencies.deficiencyText: shows any visible signs of smoke.
inoperative or indicating a malfunction.

items.itemDescription: Compression Ignition Engines Statutory Smoke Meter Test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles first used before 1 July 2008: The level specified on the manufacturer’s plate or 2.5m-1 for non-turbocharged engines, where the plate value is not available.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles first used before 1 July 2008: The level specified on the manufacturer’s plate or 3.0m-1  for turbocharged engines, where the plate value is not available.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles first used from 1 July 2008: The level specified on the manufacturer’s plate or 1.5m-1 for all CI engines, where the plate value is not available.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles first used from 1 January 2014: The level specified on the manufacturer’s plate or 0.7m-1 for all CI engines, where the plate value is not available.
The exhaust emits excessive smoke or vapour of any colour, to an extent likely to obscure vision.
The engine is idling at a speed clearly above the normal idling speed.
The exhaust emits dense blue or clearly visible black smoke for a continuous period of 5 seconds at idling speed.

items.itemDescription: Spark Ignition Engines Exhaust Gas Analyser Check:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: HC content greater than: 1200ppm for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1975 to 1 August 1994.
HC content greater than: 200ppm for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994.
CO content greater than: 4.5% for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1975 to 31 July 1986.
CO content greater than: 3.5% for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1986 to 1 August 1994 and any LPG/CNG fuelled vehicles used from 1 August 1975.
CO content greater than: 0.2% at fast idle (2500 - 3000 rpm) for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994
CO content greater than: 0.3% at idle (450  - 1500 rpm) for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994
Lambda not between: 0.97 and 1.03 for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994

deficiencies.deficiencyText: absent, or obviously defective or shows any signs of obvious tampering.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: shows any visible signs of smoke.
inoperative or indicating a malfunction.
fractured or not properly fitted such that detachment is likely.
butting causing the flange to lift more than 1.5mm from the rim and/or not properly fitted.
with any visible elongation of a stud hole.
with any visible elongation of a stud hole where secure fixing of a wheel is affected.
badly damaged or distorted (including damaged by the corners of a wheel nut cutting into the material of the wheel).
badly damaged or distorted (including damaged by the corners of a wheel nut cutting into the material of the wheel) where secure fixing of the wheel is affected.
not compatible with its fixings.
cracked (except at the bridge over the valve), weld breaking away or an inadequate repair.
made of aluminium alloy repaired by welding.
with a load rating less than that required to support the maximum permissible (GB) axle load.
cracked, badly damaged, or with a half shaft bolt, stud or nut loose or missing.
cracked, badly damaged, or with a half shaft bolt, stud or nut loose or missing where secure fixing of the wheel is affected.
with clearance between a spigot mounted wheel and the hub spigots that exceeds 3mm across the diameter.
with a wheel retaining nut or stud missing or loose or obviously not fulfilling the function of clamping the wheel to the hub.
with multiple wheel retaining nuts or studs missing or loose or obviously not fulfilling the function of clamping the wheel to the hub.
with a spigot wheel nut washer cracked.
with a wheel locating spigot or dowel missing.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the plated axle weight.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the plated axle weight and is loaded in excess of the tyre load index/ply rating.
which has a tyre use marking inappropriate for the type of axle or vehicle to which it is fitted.
of a different nominal size to another on the same axle.
of a different structure to another on the same axle.
on a steerable axle which is not of the same structure as any other tyre on any steerable axle
on a driven axle which is not of the same structure as any other tyre on any driven axle.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the axle weight.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the axle weight and is loaded in excess of the tyre load index/ply rating.

items.itemDescription: A Tyre: On a two axle motor vehicle fitted with single tyres on both axles

deficiencies.deficiencyText: a combination of tyres with structures which are not shown as acceptable in the table.
with a cut which is deep enough to reach the ply or cords, and is more than 25mm long, or 10% of the section width, whichever is greater.
with a lump, bulge or tear caused by separation or partial failure of its structure, including any lifting of the tread rubber.
with exposed ply or cord.
rubbing on any part of the vehicle.
fouling on any part of the vehicle and safe driving not impaired.
fouling on any part of the vehicle and safe driving is impaired.
incorrectly seated on its wheel.
obviously underinflated.
where the base of any groove of the original tread pattern is not clearly visible.
where the minimum tread depth and tread band requirements are not met.
in excess of ten years of age fitted to any front steered axle of a vehicle.
with a date of manufacture code illegible or not displayed on any axle (excluding a front steered axle).
with a date of manufacture code illegible or not displayed to any front steered axle of a vehicle.
in excess of ten years of age fitted to the front steered axle or any axle on a minibus with a single wheel fitment.
with a date of manufacture code illegible or not displayed (excluding a front steered axle or any axle on a minibus with single wheel fitment).
with a date of manufacture code illegible or not displayed to any front steered axle or any axle on a minibus with single wheel fitment.
fitted to a vehicle which should not have one.
on which the wholly or partly recut tread pattern is not to the manufacturer’s recut tread pattern.

with a crack passing through the swept area which renders the screen insecure or which materially affects view to the front or the sides through the area of windscreen swept by the wipers.
with any crack where there is noticeable displacement of the surfaces on either side which has an adverse effect on the condition and operation of the windscreen wipers.
with damage which exposes the inner layer of a laminated screen.
so insecure that it is likely to fall out or damaged to the extent that it presents a danger to occupants or to other road users.
with damage or obstruction, which impairs the driver’s view of a mandatory mirror.
not made from safety glass or safety glazing as specified.
made of safety glass which does not show an acceptable marking.
in such a condition it would allow water to leak into the passenger areas.
windscreen or outside window missing.
or internal screen or partition so insecure that it is likely to fall out in normal use or cause injury to any person on the vehicle.

items.itemDescription: A guard rail or barrier at a window, internal screen or partition:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing, insecure or damaged to the extent that injury to a passenger is likely.
any wheelchair restraint components deteriorated, insecure or defective but not likely to affect it's function.
any wheelchair restraint components missing, or badly deteriorated, insecure and or defective to such an extent the function is obviously affected.
any wheelchair user restraint components deteriorated, insecure or defective but not likely to affect it's function.
any wheelchair user restraint components missing,  or badly deteriorated, insecure and or defective to such an extent the function is obviously affected.

items.itemDescription: For each wheelchair space designed for a rearward facing wheelchair:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: any padded backrest missing, insecure or in a condition which is likely to cause injury to passengers.
any stanchion, fixed rail, retractable/movable device, partition or panel relating to the wheelchair area missing, insecure or in a condition which is likely to cause injury to passengers.
a lift or ramp missing, insecure or the strength of the lift or ramp is significantly impaired.
a lift or ramp which does not function as intended or does not operate through the required range of movement.
there are sharp edges or other protrusions on a lift or ramp which are likely to cause injury.
the band of contrasting colour on a lift or ramp surface edge is missing or has deteriorated to the extent that it is visually ineffective.
a lift surface does not have an effective device for preventing wheelchairs from rolling off or the device is ineffective.
cannot be stowed, failure or malfunction of any stowage retaining device (including failure to release without power supplied where appropriate) but safety not affected.
cannot be safely stowed, failure or malfunction of any stowage retaining device (including failure to release without power supplied where appropriate) that affects safety.
the safety device intended to prevent the vehicle being driven normally when the lift or ramp is not in its intended position for vehicle travel, is ineffective.

items.itemDescription: A power operated lift or ramp (additional requirements):

deficiencies.deficiencyText: defective in operation to the extent that it is likely to injure passengers, pedestrians or other road users.
with an audible device missing or inoperative. (except an Annex VII done vehicle with a powered lift).
on an Annex VII vehicle with a powered ramp the yellow warning lights are defective.
on an Annex VII vehicle with a powered ramp the yellow warning lights are missing.
incapable of being operated manually and the vehicle does not have a portable ramp.
without an effective safety device to prevent the lift or ramp from operating with the vehicle in motion.
safety device to stop the extension or retraction of a ramp or lift on meeting an obstruction inoperative and is likely to cause injury.
with no suitable storage stowage position and likely to cause injury to any passenger or crew.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing or inefective.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing, inoperative or deteriorated to the extent that the illumination is significantly reduced.

band of contrasting colour is missing or deteriorated to the extent that it is no longer visually effective.

has an operating control, which is inadequately marked.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing or defective.

items.itemDescription: For all vehicles fitted with a tachograph:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: tachograph installation/calibration plaque missing  or damaged (where required).
DIL switch cover missing, broken or damaged through interference.

items.itemDescription: For vehicles required to be fitted with a tachograph:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: tachograph scale not marked in kilometres per hour (There is no requirement for tachographs to be marked in m.p.h.).
tachograph manufacturer’s serial number/data plaque missing or not showing an “e” marking.
tachograph installation/calibration plaque out of date.
where a digital tachograph is fitted the size of drive axle  road tyres do not comply with calibration plaque.
“K” factor plaque missing.
seal missing, broken or where a clearly “non mandatory” seal has been fitted in place of an “official” seal.
an analogue or modular tachograph where the electronically indicated figure differs from prescribed ‘K’ factor by more than + or – 50.
unable to obtain a printout from a digital tachograph.
a digital tachograph that displays a ‘K’ factor reading different to that shown on the calibration plaque (there is no allowance/tolerance as with analogue type tachographs).

items.itemDescription: For vehicles not required to be fitted with a tachograph, where a tachograph is fitted in place of a speedometer:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: If a speed limiter is required (which is sensed from the tachograph head): seal missing, broken or where a clearly “non-mandatory" seal has been fitted in place of an “official" seal.

If a speed limiter is not required: a seal (within the tachograph head) missing, broken, or where a clearly “non mandatory” seal has been fitted in place of an “official” seal. There is no requirement for the gearbox sender unit to be sealed.

a brake back plate or calliper securing bolt loose or missing.
a brake back plate or calliper securing bolt loose or missing to such an extent the back plate or calliper is insecure.
a brake, lining or pad less than 1.5mm thick at any point.
a brake, lining or pad, missing, incorrectly fitted, insecure or with the lining/pad no longer visible.
restricted movement of a brake component.
a brake drum, disc, lining or pad contaminated by oil or grease.
a brake drum, disc, lining or pad contaminated by oil or grease with the brake performance obviously affected.
defective in operation.
modification to any part of the braking system.
unsafe modification to any part of the braking system and braking performance is affected.
lightly corroded
insecure, excessively corroded, or leaking.
with damage or dents that do not significantly reduce the capacity.
with damage or dents that obviously significantly reduce the capacity.
with a securing strap fractured, cracked, excessively corroded or chafing on the reservoir or other mounting.
missing where it is known to be a standard fitting.

items.itemDescription: Air actuators, hydraulic master & wheel cylinders, valves and servos:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: defective in operation.
defective in operation and brake performance affected.
insecure but still operational.
insecure and brake performance affected.
leaking air or fluid, fractured, cracked, excessively damaged or corroded.
leaking air or fluid, fractured, cracked, excessively damaged or corroded and brake performance is affected.
with a locking device missing or insecure.
with insufficient or excessive travel of operating mechanism indicating a need for adjustment.
with insufficient or excessive travel of operating mechanism indicating a need for adjustment and brake performance is affected.
with a cap missing from a hydraulic master cylinder and/or fluid obviously contaminated.
fluid below minimum level or level warning device defective/activated.
fluid significantly below minimum level.
no visible fluid.
with a valve with excessive discharge of oil.
a load sensing valve removed or disconnected when it is known to be a standard fitment.
a load sensing valve obviously seized or restricted in its free movement, linkage or brackets cracked, defective or out of adjustment (ABS functioning).
a load sensing valve obviously seized or restricted in its free movement, linkage or brackets cracked, defective or out of adjustment. (No ABS function).
hydraulic brake actuator dust cover damaged or deteriorated but not to the extent that it would no longer prevent the ingress of dirt etc.
hydraulic brake actuator dust cover missing, insecure, excessively damaged or severely deteriorated to the extent that it would no longer prevent the ingress of dirt etc.

items.itemDescription: A load sensing data plate is:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing or illegible.
a drive belt missing, badly deteriorated and/ or so loose that it is likely to slip.
a compressor drive pulley loose, cracked or missing.

items.itemDescription: Reflectors, conspicuity markings and/or rear markers:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: incorrectly positioned.
missing, incorrectly positioned and red colour is reflected to the front or white to the rear.
insecure.
insecure and likely to become detached.
not clearly visible.
of the incorrect type fitted.
dirty or ineffective.
so dirty or ineffective that its function is obviously impaired.
broken, damaged or incomplete.
broken, damaged or incomplete to the extent that the reflecting area is significantly reduced.
not of the appropriate colour.
not of the appropriate colour with red colour reflected to the front or white colour to the rear.
incorrectly positioned.
missing, incorrectly positioned and red colour is reflected to the front or white to the rear.
insecure.
insecure and likely to become detached.
not clearly visible.
of the incorrect type fitted.
dirty or ineffective.
so dirty or ineffective that its function is obviously impaired.
broken, damaged or incomplete.
broken, damaged or incomplete to the extent that the reflecting area is significantly reduced.
not of the appropriate colour.
not of the appropriate colour with red colour reflected to the front or white colour to the rear.
more than two (vehicles/trailers up to 6m in length) or four (vehicles/trailers over 6m in length) optional reversing lamps fitted.
does not operate automatically when reverse gear is selected.
any lamp insecure but unlikely to become detached
any lamp insecure and likely to become detached.
an obligatory lamp missing or inoperative
an obligatory lamp dim due to dirt or internal deterioration or with a partially reduced light output.
an obligatory lamp dim due to dirt or internal deterioration or with an obvious major reduction in light output.
an obligatory lamp lens obscured partially, insecure, or damaged but not likely to fall apart.
a obligatory lamp lens missing, obscured, insecure and or damaged so it is likely to fall apart.
an obligatory lamp not showing a light of the right colour.
an obligatory lamp not showing a light of the right colour with red light shown to the front or white light shown to the rear.
an obligatory lamp incorrectly positioned.
an obligatory lamp is affected by the operation of any other lamp.

items.itemDescription: Rear Fog lamp:(in addition to 1 above)

deficiencies.deficiencyText: tell-tale light not fitted, not working or cannot be seen by the driver.
more than two rear fog lamps are fitted.
non obligatory rear fog lamp(s) affected by the operation of the foot brake and or shows the incorrect colour.

items.itemDescription: No stop lamps (in addition to 1 above)

deficiencies.deficiencyText: show a steady red light when the brakes are applied, or all lamps do not go out when the brakes are released.
not forming part of a matched pair.
not positioned symmetrically in relation to the other lamp.
one of a matched pair does not show a light of the same intensity and colour as the other.
a main beam headlamp cannot be switched off by operating one switch which at the same time leaves a pair of dipped beams.
main beam warning lamp does not illuminate when main beam is selected and extinguish when dipped beam is selected.
cleaning device inoperative.
cleaning device inoperative for LED or  gas discharge (HID) systems.

items.itemDescription: A rear registration plate lamp (in addition to 1 above)

deficiencies.deficiencyText: throws direct light to the rear.

items.itemDescription: Front fog lamp (in addition to 1 above)

deficiencies.deficiencyText: inoperative.

items.itemDescription: Day time running lamp (in addition to 1 above):

deficiencies.deficiencyText: not showing a light of the right colour.
not showing a light of the right colour with red light shown to the front or white light shown to the rear.
incorrectly positioned.

imDescription: Direction Indicators and Hazard Warning Lamps

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing, inoperative, operating on the wrong side of a vehicle/trailer, not visible either to the front, side, or to the rear.
a lamp dim due to dirt or internal deterioration or with partially reduced light output.
a lamp dim due to dirt or internal deterioration or with an obvious major reduction in light output.
lens insecure or damaged with no effect on light output.
lens missing, insecure or damaged so that it is likely to fall apart to such an extent that light output is obviously affected.
does not flash at between 60 to 120 times a minute.
does not show a light of the right colour.
tell-tale not fitted, is inoperative or cannot be seen/heard by the driver.
does not operate with the engine stopped and the ignition switched off and on.
all the direction indicator lamps do not operate simultaneously when switched on by one switch.
tell-tale not fitted, is inoperative or cannot be seen by the driver.

items.itemDescription: European checked on Dipped Beam: In relation to the 0% Horizontal line, the beam horizontal cut-off line is not between the limits listed below.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: Headlamp centres up to and including 850mm high Upper limit: All vehicles. 0.5%  Lower limit: All vehicles  4.0%
Headlamp centres over 850mm high Upper limit: All vehicles. 1.25%  Lower limit: All vehicles 4.0%

items.itemDescription: European checked on Dipped Beam: The beam image contains:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: a “Kick up” that is not visible on the screen

items.itemDescription: European checked on Dipped Beam: White light:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: shows in the zone formed by the 0% vertical and 0.5% horizontal lines.

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Dipped Beam: In relation to the 0% Horizontal line, the upper edge of the “Hot Spot” is not between the limits listed below.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: All headlamp heights, Upper limit: All vehicles. 0%, Lower limit: All vehicles 4.0%

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Dipped Beam: The right hand edge of the “Hot Spot”:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: is to the right of the vertical 0% line, or more than 2% to the left of it.

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Dipped Beam: A Headlamp

deficiencies.deficiencyText: dips to the right (See note in Applications).

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Main Beam: In relation to the 0% Horizontal line, the Centre of the “Hot Spot” is not between the limits listed below.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: Headlamp centres up to and including 850mm high, Upper limit: All vehicles. 0%, Lower limit: All vehicles. 2.0%.
Headlamp centres over 850mm high, Upper limit: All vehicles. 0%, Lower limit: All vehicles. 2.75%.

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Main Beam: In any case the centre of the “Hot Spot”

deficiencies.deficiencyText: is to the right of the vertical 0% line or more than 2% to the left of it.

items.itemDescription: British American Checked on Main Beam: A Headlamp

deficiencies.deficiencyText: dips to the right (see note in Application).
A brake on any wheel binding.
Brake mechanism on any wheel sticking, indicated by an abnormal time lag before an increased reading is obtained.

With service brake applied at a steady pedal pressure, the indication of brake effort fluctuates regularly with each brake revolution of the road wheel, on a steered axle, so much that the ovality of any brake drum is obvious. A fluctuation reading in excess of 70%, between highest and lowest indicated readings is to be considered a deficiency.

items.itemDescription: All Roller Brake Test Machines: With the service brake fully applied:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: there is very little brake effort at any wheel.
there is no brake effort at any wheel.
braking effort from any wheel on an axle is less than 70% of the brake effort from another wheel on the same axle.
braking effort from any wheel on an axle is less than 50% of the brake effort from another wheel on the same axle in the case of steered axles.
the specified brake effort is not met.
the braking efficiency recorded by decelerometer is below the specified efficiency.
the vehicle deviates appreciably from a straight line.

items.itemDescription: All Roller Brake Test Machines, with the secondary brake fully applied:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: there is very little braking effort at any wheel equipped with a brake operated by the secondary brake system.
there is no braking effort at all on any wheel equipped with a brake operated by the secondary brake system.
braking effort from any wheel on an axle is less than 70% of the brake effort from another wheel on the same axle.
braking effort from any wheel on an axle is less than 50% of the brake effort from another wheel on the same axle in the case of steered axles.
the specified brake effort is not met.
the braking efficiency recorded by decelerometer is below the specified efficiency.
the vehicle deviates appreciably from a straight line.

items.itemDescription: Roller Brake Test: With the parking brake fully applied:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: there is very little braking effort at any wheel equipped with a brake operated by the parking brake system.
there is no braking effort at all on any wheel equipped with a brake operated by the parking brake system.
the specified brake effort is not met.
the braking efficiency recorded by decelerometer is below the specified efficiency.
the vehicle deviates appreciably from a straight line.

items.itemDescription: A defect not described elsewhere in the manual such that:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: the use of the vehicle or trailer on the road would involve an immediate danger of injury to any person.

items.itemDescription: A defect not described elsewhere in the manual such that:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: the use of the vehicle on the road would involve an immediate danger of injury to any other person.
